bioAsHtml: Robert is the architect and lead of the JShell (the OpenJDK Kulla project), bringing a REPL to the Java platform. He was in charge of the compiler and runtime implementation of Lambdas in JDK 8. Robert was chief implementer of the JavaFX script compiler. He was architect of the profiling and debugging APIs and frameworks in the Java platform: Java Virtual Machine Tool Interface (JVMTI), Java Platform Debugger Architecture (JPDA), Java Debug Interface (JDI), Java Debug Wire Protocol (JDWP), and the Java Virtual Machine Debug Interface (JVMDI). Robert invented javadoc Doclets. Previously he worked at ParcPlace Systems developing the Smalltalk Virtual Machine and developer tools.

acceptedTalks.title: JShell: An Interactive Shell for the Java Platform

bio: Robert is the architect and lead of the JShell (the OpenJDK Kulla project), bringing a REPL to the Java platform.  He was in charge of the compiler and runtime implementation of Lambdas in JDK 8.  Robert was chief implementer of the JavaFX script compiler.  He was architect of the profiling and debugging APIs and frameworks in the Java platform: Java Virtual Machine Tool Interface (JVMTI), Java Platform Debugger Architecture (JPDA), Java Debug Interface (JDI), Java Debug Wire Protocol (JDWP), and the Java Virtual Machine Debug Interface (JVMDI). Robert invented javadoc Doclets. Previously he worked at ParcPlace Systems developing the Smalltalk Virtual Machine and developer tools.
